org.mdconverter.api.plugin.context

Interface Context

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPlugin, AbstractReader, AbstractWriter

    public interface Context
    This interface defines the common ground for reader and writer plugins Created by miso on 28.10.2015.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getDescription()
      Is called by the framework during plugin loading to inform user about plugin functionality
      String getName()
      Is called by the framework to display user a readable name of the plugin (name defined in manifest.json)
      PluginManifest getPluginManifest() 
      String getUsage()
      This method is called by the framework, if plugin throws InvalidParameterException
      void setArguments(Map<String,String> args)
      Provides the possibility to the framework to commit given user input arguments to the plugin
      void setUnspecifiedArguments(List<String> args)
      Provides the possibility to the framework to commit given user input arguments which aren't defined nor added as plugin specific argument

    • Method Detail

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        Is called by the framework during plugin loading to inform user about plugin functionality
        Returns:
        a String with the description of the plugin.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Is called by the framework to display user a readable name of the plugin (name defined in manifest.json)
        Returns:
        a String with the name of the plugin.

      • getPluginManifest

        PluginManifest getPluginManifest()
        Returns:
        a PluginManifest containing the configuration parameters defined in manifest.json of the plugin

      • setArguments

        void setArguments(Map<String,String> args)
        Provides the possibility to the framework to commit given user input arguments to the plugin
        Parameters:
        args - a Map<String, String> holding the user arguments for the plugin

      • setUnspecifiedArguments

        void setUnspecifiedArguments(List<String> args)
        Provides the possibility to the framework to commit given user input arguments which aren't defined nor added as plugin specific argument
        Parameters:
        args - a List<String> containing unspecified arguments

      • getUsage

        String getUsage()
        This method is called by the framework, if plugin throws InvalidParameterException
        Returns:
        a String containing the help for a plugin
